Comment 5: 
> and the compiler correctly told me that v was already declared, so I just
> 'blindly'
> removed it and here we are :)

You need to say "v = new(NewMyType)" with = not := since v exists already.

> While I agree that it is not a bug per se, a runtime crash (without any
> warning from
> the compiler) seems a bit surprising, don't you think?

Not really.  You asked to dereference a nil pointer.
As should be abundantly clear from the incredibly
long thread on the mailing list, Go lets you do that.  ;-)
